title: Gluten-Free Apple Fritters with Caramel Sauce

ingredients.content: 3 ½ oz semi-sweet chocolate, cut into pieces
9 oz Granny Smith apples, cored and sliced (1 in. thick)

preparations.content: Place sugar, baking soda and whipping cream into mixing bowl and cook <b>65 min/195°F/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place chocolate and whipping cream into mixing bowl and warm <b>5 min/195°F/speed 1<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place sushi rice and masa harina into mixing bowl and grind <b>1 min/speed 10<b>.
Add eggs, baking powder and beer and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Place enough oil (approx. 2 in.) in a cooking pot and place on the stove on high heat.

Dip the apple slices in fritter mixture to coat. Fry in hot oil until lightly brown. Transfer apple fritters into a dish lined with paper towel to remove any excess oil. Sprinkle with salt and cinnamon. Serve immediately with caramel and chocolate sauces.
